class_notes:
Engaging the Visual: Photos, Videos, and Memes
The visual is vital to how each of us makes sense of the world around us and online. Engaging the Visual offers tools to think critically about photography, film, art, theatre, memes, material objects, as well as collective cultural practices. Using the still photograph as a launching point and prioritizing aspects of culture that are made to be seen, this course introduces students to forms of `visual literacy' - the ability to think as analytically about images as one does about text by focusing on how visual media is created, circulated, and consumed. Central to this course are student-driven 'visual experiments' informed by anthropological and interdisciplinary theory, methods, and concrete examples. Assignments and class discussion open avenues for students to engage media and the visual world in relation to their own experiences as well as issues of identity, race, gender, globalization, and development.
